com.badlogic.gdx.graphics
Interface TextureData

public interface TextureData

Loads image data for a texture. Used with Texture, this allows custom image loading for managed textures. If the OpenGL context is lost, the TextureData will be asked to load again when the context is restored. The TextureData doesn't necessary need to keep the image data in memory between loads.

Method Summary
 int getHeight()
          Returns the height of the texture, which must be a power of two.
 int getWidth()
          Returns the width of the texture, which must be a power of two.
 void load()
          Loads the image data into the currently bound texture.
 

Method Detail

load

void load()
Loads the image data into the currently bound texture. Usually GLCommon.glTexImage2D(int, int, int, int, int, int, int, int, java.nio.Buffer) is used.

getWidth

int getWidth()
Returns the width of the texture, which must be a power of two. This will not be called before load().

getHeight

int getHeight()
Returns the height of the texture, which must be a power of two. This will not be called before load().
